fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you capture a screenshot then copy and paste it to Confluence editor, the image will appear broken when Published.

h3. Environment
Firefox 54.0.1 (64-bit)
Confluence 1000.1726.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Confluence using Firefox 54.0.1
# Edit a Confluence page
# Capture a screenshot using Lightshot Screenshot
# Copy and paste it to Confluence editor
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
* The screenshot should be attached to the page and it should be visible after Published.

h3. Actual Results
* The screenshot is not attached to the page and it's appearing 'Broken Image' after published.
 
h3.Workaround
Use another browser to insert screenshots like Chrome
fields.summary: Adding screenshots to Confluence using Firefox is not working

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Subscribing to JIRA external gadgets from one JIRA Cloud instance on another Confluence Cloud instance does not allow to use the JIRA gadgets in Confluence.

h3. Environment
* 1 JIRA Cloud instance
* 1 Confluence Cloud instance

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# For Atlassian Support, add the JIRA External gadgets URL to Confluence Cloud.
# Attempt to insert JIRA gadgets on a Confluence page.

h3. Expected Results
You are able to insert JIRA gadgets on your Confluence page.

h3. Actual Results
The JIRA gadgets are not available in Confluence.
 
h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: External gadgets from JIRA Cloud instances are not working in Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
Hi there,

Thanks for creating the roadmap planner macros, and it is awesome for showing the team bigger picture. While we can create different roadmaps with this macro, would it be possible that we can insert the same roadmap created previously at different pages? And the two (or more) same roadmaps should be synced so that one would change accordingly when another one is changed?

As a product manager, I want to insert the saved roadmap and have them synced automatically, so that our teams can view the roadmap at different pages and time could be saved.

Our team'd greatly appreciate if our suggestion can be implemented. 

Cheers,

Jane
fields.summary: Sync Roadmap Planners at different pages

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you access spaces through Space Directory, it's redirecting to a wrong URL causing the page to be blank. It's missing for instance the '/overview'

h3. Environment
Confluence 1000.0.0-637d4df

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access Space Directory 
# Try to access a Space 

h3. Expected Results
* It should redirect to the right URL: 
{code}https://{instance}.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/{spacekey}/overview{code}

h3. Actual Results
* It is redirecting to a wrong URL causing the page to be blank. 
{code}https://{instance}.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/{spacekey}{code}
 
h3.Workaround
* Add */overview* to the space URL 
* Example: {code}https://{instance}.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/{spacekey}/overview{code}
fields.summary: Links to space redirecting to wrong URL

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When [Coniguring the Colour Scheme|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/customizing-color-schemes-724765499.html] to use a text other than white, it will not be respected for the favourite spaces in the Home Screen. The text is white and it can conflict with white backgrounds.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Pick a Space to be your favourite (Spaces, on the sidebar > Click on the *star* to favourite one of them)
# Change the Colour Scheme to use any other color than white, for the text. 
# Go to the Dashboard of Confluence

h3. Expected Results
The text colour of the favourites should be matching with the one from the colour scheme.

h3. Actual Results
The text is white, as the example below:

!text.png|thumbnail!


h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Text For Favourite Spaces in Sidebar does not Match with Confluence's New Look Colour Scheme

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When sending notifications for actions in Team Calendars (like adding users to events), the thumbnails/avatars of the users are not displayed in the email notification:

!calendar.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On Team Calendars, create a new Calendar
# Make sure to add a new Event
# After creating the event, under the *Who* field, make sure to add multiple users
# Look for the notification sent

h3. Expected Results
All the thumbnails and Avatars should be displayed like it's configured in Confluence

h3. Actual Results
The thumbnails/Avatars are displayed with the default picture.

h3. Notes
No patterns. It affects specific users for the event part. For the user who *creates* the notification, the avatar is never displayed. Attached a screenshot with the users and their current avatars. 

h3.Workaround
No workaround found.
fields.summary: Avatars Are not Displayed in Team Calendars Notifications

fields.description: h3. Summary Code Block Macro doesn't allow pasting tags '<>' h3. Environment Confluence New Look and Feel (ADG3) h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a Page # Add a Code Block Macro # Anywhere (text editor, notepad, Confluence itself), type anything between "<>". e.g.: "" and copy this text # Try to paste it inside Code Block Macro h3. Expected Results Text should be pasted normally h3. Actual Results Nothing Happens. h3. Notes * If you type something between tags like " text " only what is outside of tags. In this case, only "text" is pasted. * You are able to manually type text within with no problems.
fields.summary: Code Block Macro doesn't allow pasting tags '<>'

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Adding multiple Include Page macro on a page to display the contents of another page that has expand macro on it will intermittently add extra spacing in between. 

h3. Environment
Confluence 1000.0.0-c52fe44

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add an Expand Macro to page 1, page 2 and page 3
# Add a three Include page macro to Page 4 to display the content of Page 1, page 2 and page 3

h3. Expected Results
There should not be an extra spacing in between the Include page macros

h3. Actual Results
An extra spacing is added in between the Include page macros
 
h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Extra Spacing when adding multiple Include Page macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary
'Page properties report' macro broken when nested with 'Office powerpoint' macro

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Confluence, create a page with a Page Properties Report macro on it
# Add a table in the macro body, use 'Office powerpoint' macro in one of the table cells.
 !1.png|thumbnail! 
# Add a label to the page which can ben used in subsequent steps to configure Page properties report macro
 !2.png|thumbnail! 
# Now, create a new page with Page properties report macro
# Configure Page properties report macro to use the label (mentioned in step 3) and table columns to display.
 !3.png|thumbnail! 
# Preview the macro and save it, and finally publish the page.
 !4.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Page should display the powerpoint slide properly in the page properties report page as similar to the parent page.

h3. Actual Results
Slide from the page properties shows blank in page properties report macro page.
 !5.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3.Workaround
Insert Powerpoint presentation as a file instead of using it in 'Office powerpoint' macro in the parent page so that slide will display properly in the page properties report macro.
fields.summary: Page properties report broken when nested with Office powerpoint macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In a Confluence Cloud Instance which has the [New Look|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/new-navigation-and-a-new-look-for-confluence-881536766.html], Customers using a Site Logo which has a White or Light Colored Background are unable to view the links to Spaces under My Spaces

h3. Environment
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a [Custom Site Logo|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ConfCloud/Changing+the+Site+Logo] to Confluence; use the following example image:
 [^confluence_on_white.jpg]
# Navigate Home

h3. Expected Results
All Links are visible

h3. Actual Results
The Detected Colors from the Site Logo set the background of the Sidebar to be a light color which prevents the links to Spaces listed under My Spaces from being visible. 
!WhiteBG-SiteLogo.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
The "Text and icons" setting within Color Scheme > Sidebar Colors does not affect the links under "My Spaces" 

h3.Workaround
- Reset the Color Scheme to it's default value: Settings > Color Scheme > Edit > Reset
- Edit the Image File used for the Site Logo in an editor of your choosing and set the background color to a darker color or apply an Alpha (Transparent) background. 
- Manually Edit the Sidebar Color (Settings > Color Scheme > Edit > Background) and set it to a darker color
fields.summary: Unable to View My Spaces Link with Custom White Background Site Logo

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Creating a page that has a title with a special character like "#" for example "Test Page #1" Will fail to be redirected to by the "Go to Included Page" Button on the "Include Page" macro.

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# create a page that has a "#" in the title
# create a new page with any title
# edit the new page and add the "include" macro select the page with the "#" that you created in the first step
# Once it has been added, (while you are still in edit mode) Hover over the macro and select the "Go to Included page" button from the pop-out menu


h3. Expected Results
You are redirected to the target page as normal.

h3. Actual Results
You get an apache Tomcat 400 Error:
{quote}
HTTP Status 400 - The contentId was not a number.

type Status report

message The contentId was not a number.

description The request sent by the client was syntactically incorrect.
{quote}

h3. Notes
NA

h3.Workaround
Rename the page to eliminate special characters like "#"
fields.summary: "Go to included page" button cannot properly redirect to pages with special characters in the title.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When changing the [Confluence Home|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/configuring-the-site-home-page-724765517.html] to any page other than the default dashboard, it will revert the site to the previous look, instead of the [new look of Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/new-navigation-and-a-new-look-for-confluence-881536766.html]. This is affecting the whole instance. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# As an administrator in Confluence, go to *General Configuration > Further Configuration*
# Click on the *Site Home Page* option and make sure to select a created page in any space.
# *Save* the modification.

h3. Expected Results
Only change the site home page, and continue using the new look of Confluence, since it's already applied.

h3. Actual Results
After changing the Home page, it will instantly revert to the previous look. Either in the administration console or spaces/pages. 
 
h3. Notes
Since the user does not have the *Opt Out/Opt In* option available, there will have no method to go back to the new look. Only changing the site homepage to default. 

h3.Workaround
No workaround found.
fields.summary: New Confluence Look is Reverted by Changing Site Homepage

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you previously enabled Team Calendar then Disable the Team Calendar. The contribution updates will still be visible in All Updates even if the user doesn't have permission to view the space that is associated to the Team Calendar. 

h3. Environment
Confluence 1000.0.0-34f243d

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable Team Calendar add-on
# Create a Team Calendar and associate it to a Space
# Disable the Team Calendar add-on 
# Restrict the Space 

h3. Expected Results
* User who doesn't have permission to the space should not be able to view the Team Calendar contribution updates from 'All Updates'

h3. Actual Results
* User can view the Team Calendar contribution of the restricted space associated to the Team Calendar from 'All Updates'
 
h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Team Calendar contribution of a restricted Space is visible in the 'All Updates' page

fields.description:
Summary
 The issue with images quality with size around 4 MB.

Steps to reproduce
 # Attach the images on the page
 # Set image as original
 # Zoom in the page and become unreadable.

Expected Result
 * When zoom in the quality of the image does not compress that much.

Actual Result
 * When zoom in the quality of the image was compressed a lot and makes the text is unreadable.

Workaround
 # Insert the images into PDF file
 # Attach the PDF file on the Confluence page using PDF macro.

fields.description:
It was observed in that during JIRA performance degradation, Confluence can gradually become unresponsive due to threads apparently attempting to read gadget feeds from JIRA.

Thread dumps taken from the Confluence JVM during this time will show the majority of HTTP threads (245 out of 300 in the case observed) looking like the below:
{code}
"http-nio-8090-exec-232" #424 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007f4aac0d0000 nid=0xca62 waiting on condition [0x00007f47c49c4000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
	at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
	- parking to wait for  <0x00000003cd4014d0> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:175)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject.await(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:2039)
	at org.codehaus.httpcache4j.cache.Mutex.acquire(Mutex.java:45)
	at org.codehaus.httpcache4j.cache.HTTPCache.doCachedRequest(HTTPCache.java:103)
	at org.codehaus.httpcache4j.cache.HTTPCache.doCachedRequest(HTTPCache.java:80)
	at com.atlassian.gadgets.directory.internal.impl.GadgetFeedReaderImpl.<init>(GadgetFeedReaderImpl.java:46)
	at com.atlassian.gadgets.directory.internal.impl.GadgetFeedReaderFactoryImpl.getFeedReader(GadgetFeedReaderFactoryImpl.java:28)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor3143.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:307)
	at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.doInvoke(ServiceInvoker.java:58)
	at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.invoke(ServiceInvoker.java:62)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.doProceed(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:131)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:119)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)

	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.doProceed(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:131)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:119)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:204)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy2822.getFeedReader(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.gadgets.metadata.GadgetsMacroMetadataProvider.getUrisFromFeedStore(GadgetsMacroMetadataProvider.java:240)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.gadgets.metadata.GadgetsMacroMetadataProvider.getGadgetUris(GadgetsMacroMetadataProvider.java:225)

	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.gadgets.metadata.CachingGadgetsMacroMetadataProvider.getSummaries(CachingGadgetsMacroMetadataProvider.java:157)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.macro.browser.DefaultMacroMetadataManager.buildMacroSummaries(DefaultMacroMetadataManager.java:123)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.macro.browser.DefaultMacroMetadataManager.getAllMacroSummaries(DefaultMacroMetadataManager.java:42)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.macro.browser.DefaultMacroBrowserManager.getMacroSummaries(DefaultMacroBrowserManager.java:66)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.macro.browser.actions.BrowseMacrosAction.getSummaries(BrowseMacrosAction.java:58)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.macro.browser.actions.BrowseMacrosAction.execute(BrowseMacrosAction.java:36)

	at com.atlassian.core.filters.AbstractHttpFilter.doFilter(AbstractHttpFilter.java:31)

	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContextValve.invoke(StandardContextValve.java:122)
	at org.apache.catalina.authenticator.AuthenticatorBase.invoke(AuthenticatorBase.java:501)
	at org.apache.catalina.valves.AccessLogValve.invoke(AccessLogValve.java:950)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardHostValve.invoke(StandardHostValve.java:170)
	at org.apache.catalina.valves.ErrorReportValve.invoke(ErrorReportValve.java:98)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardEngineValve.invoke(StandardEngineValve.java:116)
	at org.apache.catalina.connector.CoyoteAdapter.service(CoyoteAdapter.java:408)
	at org.apache.coyote.http11.AbstractHttp11Processor.process(AbstractHttp11Processor.java:1040)
	at org.apache.coyote.AbstractProtocol$AbstractConnectionHandler.process(AbstractProtocol.java:607)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.net.NioEndpoint$SocketProcessor.doRun(NioEndpoint.java:1721)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.net.NioEndpoint$SocketProcessor.run(NioEndpoint.java:1679)
	- locked <0x000000048d4da578> (a org.apache.tomcat.util.net.NioChannel)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{code}

These threads will be long-running and appear in multiple thread dumps taken over a period of time. The impact to users is that eventually Confluence will not have enough threads free in order to service users.

h3.Expected Behaviour

There should be a limit for number of requests for applink communication to avoid performance on other application.  Especially if the other application is not responsive.

h3. Workaround
Effort should be made to address the JIRA performance problem as that is the trigger for this bug. In the short term, the JIRA gadget feed may be temporarily removed from Confluence Admin > External Gadgets in order to avoid further outages.
fields.summary: Confluence performance can degrade when JIRA/Bamboo has performance problems due to gadget feed retrieval

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Tables copied from Excerpt Macros are not pasted correctly

h3. Environment
Confluence New Look and Feel (ADG3)

h3. Description
After copying a table inside an Excerpt Macro, pasting it will paste the table contents without the table itself.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Page with an Excerpt / MultiExcerpt Macro.
# Add a Table to that macro
# Select the Table, then Copy
# Paste the table outside the macro

h3. Expected Results
The table should be pasted normally:

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
It only pastes the table contents, without the table:

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Tables copied from Excerpt Macros are not pasted correctly

fields.description:
h3. Summary
With Confluence new design enabled, if an iframe is used on the page, the anchor macro will not redirect the user to the correct location if the link is open in a new tab/window (can be seen with the *Table of Content* macro).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable Confluence new design.
# On a page with an iframe and a table of content, open of the link from the ToC macro in a new tab/window.

h3. Expected Results
You are properly redirected to the correct anchor on the page.

h3. Actual Results
The page opens at the top of the page ignoring the anchor.
 
h3.Workaround
Turn off Confluence new design for now by clicking on your profile picture in the bottom left then *Turn off for now*.
fields.summary: Opening an anchor link in a new tab/window does not work if an iframe is present on that page
The natural size of image is smaller than data-image-height(width), so it blur

fields.description:
Summary
* Confluence import from Word not place on the child page.

The structure of the space pages below: 
Parent page
----Child page

Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a Child page of the space.
# Go to ellipsis(...) > Import from Word.

Expected Results
* The result of imported word on the same level with the child page.
Parent page
----Child page
----Imported word

Actual Results

----Child page
Imported word

fields.summary: Confluence import from Word not place on the child page

fields.description:
I have been working with a very long table with some 200 rows with multiple rows of text in each row. The need for the table has been very well satisfied by Confluence, and really happy with the information we have been able to store in the table.

When *viewing* the table, the frozen header row is extremely helpful for scrolling down. It would be handy to be able to select more than one row as "header" rows, but that is another issue.

However, when *editing* the table, it is a pain not to have the header row visible, to confirm what each column is for.

My suggestion is that, if possible around still being able to edit the header row, that when scrolling down in a table in *edit* mode, that the header row is also frozen to make the editing of the various columns of data significantly easier.
fields.summary: Freeze Table Header Row when in Edit

fields.description:

{noformat} h3. Workaround A workaround is to use Cookie authentication but this is not always possible since you need to call the JIRA session endpoint in order to get the session cookie and if you only have Confluence this is not possible. *Example 1:* 1. Call the JIRA session endpoint to get the session created and store the cookie information in the file named cookie.txt {noformat} curl -H "Content-Type: application/json" -c cookie.txt -d '{"username":"XXXXXXXXX", "password":"XXXXXXXX" }' -X POST https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/rest/auth/1/session {"session":{"name":"cloud.session.token","value":"eyJraWQiOiJzZXNzaW9uLXNlcnZpY2VcL3Nlc3Npb24tc2VydmljZSIsImFsZyI6IlJTMjU2In0.eyJzdWIiOiI1NTcwNTc6ODgzMDI0YzYtOTY2ZS00YTcyLTkzNDQtYjU4MDE2MWY2MjRjIiwiYXVkIjoiYXRsYXNzaWFuIiwiaW1wZXJzb25hdGlvbiI6W10sIm5iZiI6MTQ5ODY0N....................2qcRA"}} {noformat} 2. Use the Cookie to authenticate the successive REST API calls (against Confluence): {noformat} curl -b cookie.txt -H "Accept: application/json" -H "Content-Type: application/json" https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/space {"results":[{"id":589874,"key":"ds","name":"Demonstration Space","type":"global","status":"current","_expandable":{"settings":"/rest/api/space/ds/settings","metadata":"","operations":"","lookAndFeel":"/rest/api/settings/lookandfeel?spaceKey=ds","permissions":"","icon":"","description":"","theme":"/rest/api/space/ds/theme","homepage":"/rest/api/content/38096"....................} {noformat} *Example 2:* # If you're on Chrome, you can install an extension calls *cookies.txt* # Then, log into your instance and click on the extension # Copy the cookie information (the data shown in the extension) and save it to a text file # Use the cookie stored in the text file to authenticate REST API calls by using the *-b* argument in Curl. Example: {code:java} curl -b path/of/file/cookie.txt -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X GET https://example.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/TEST-1 {code}

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Email notifications sent to watchers have its date set to one day off of the actual event date. It happens when the calendar has its timezone set to any positive UTC offset (starting at UTC+00:00) and only for *"All day"* events.

h3. Tested on:
* Confluence 1000.1692.0
* Confluence 1000.0.0-16065ca
* Team Calendar 1000.0.37
* System time set to Americas/Sao Paulo

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a new calendar
# Choose any positive UTC offset (can be anything ranging from UTC+00:00 to UTC+12:00)
# Add a few watchers
# Create an *All day* event

h4. In Team Calendar's UI

 !Screen Shot 2017-07-17 at 4.07.14 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Email Notification

 !Screen Shot 2017-07-17 at 4.08.10 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Do not mark events as "All Day", and instead fill out the time period.
fields.summary: Team Calendar email notifications are sent one day off for positive UTC offsets

fields.description:
h3. Summary
With Confluence new design enabled, pasting XML content in a Code block macro will strip all XML tags.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Insert a *Code block* macro on a page and paste some XML content in it.

h3. Expected Results
The XML content is pasted as is and highlights properly.

h3. Actual Results
All XML tags are stripped.
 
h3.Workaround
Either fill the XML code manually or turn off Confluence new design by clicking on your profile picture then *Turn off for now*.
fields.summary: Code macro strips XML tags and line breaks when Confluence new design is enabled

fields.description:
h3. Summary
With Confluence new design, it is not possible to remove space shortcuts from the sidebar.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a space shortcuts in your space sidebar.
# Click on the *...* button to remove it.

h3. Expected Results
You have an option to remove your space shortcut.

h3. Actual Results
The button does not work and you are unable to remove the space shortcut.
 
h3.Workaround
Go back to the old design by clicking on your profile picture then *Turn off for now*. Remove your space shortcut and turn on the new design again by clicking on your profile picture then *Experience the new Confluence*.
fields.summary: Space shortcuts cannot be removed with Confluence new design

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When trying to access the Marketplace Site and start a *Free Trial* for an add-on in Cloud, it will not allow the user to have it installed once redirected to the instance again.

 h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to https://marketplace.atlassian.com
# Search for an add-on to be installed
# Click on *Free Trial* and it will redirect the user to the instance 
# The add-on installation process will keep spinning and no results will be retrieved

h3. Expected Results
The add-on installation should give a popup for the user start using it

h3. Actual Results

The installation process keeps spinning.

The below exception is thrown on the console::
{code}
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'subscriptionAnnual' of undefined
at q.getPricingDescription (com.atlassian.upm.atlassian-universal-plugin-manager-plugin:upm-js-libraries.js:1397)
{code}

!error.png|thumbnail!
 
h3.Workaround
(If there is no workaround directly say so)

Instead of going directly to https://marketplace.atlassian.com the user should access the *Manage Add-ons* page inside the Confluence Administration. Specifically, the *Install new Add-ons* option (https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/plugins/servlet/upm/marketplace)
fields.summary: Installing Add-ons Directly from Marketplace Does not Work

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a user has a username with a space in it upon creating their personal space, the space key will replace the space by a *+* character.
This will cause the space to not load with Confluence new design as all link with this *+* sign will not load.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attempt to reach a page where the URL includes a *+* sign in its space key.

h3. Expected Results
The page loads properly.

h3. Actual Results
The page loads forever.
 
h3.Workaround
You can either replace the *+* sign in the URL by *%20* for the page to load properly or disable Confluence new design.
You can disable the new design by clicking on your profile picture in the bottom left then *Turn off for now* button.
fields.summary: Confluence new design does not support space in space key

fields.description:

h3. Environment
* Confluence new design enabled

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Insert a *Create from template* macro on the page while in the *Editor*.
# Click on the *Template* list

h3. Expected Results
A list of your templates is displayed.

h3. Actual Results
The templates list is empty.
 
h3.Workaround
Disable the new design by clicking on your profile picture then *Turn off for now*. Once done, you will be able to use the *Create from template* macro properly.
fields.summary: Create from template macro not working with Confluence new design

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you access a calendar from within the space, the events of the calendar have a grey bar on top of them when you hover your mouse over the event type, making it very hard to select them to be displayed or not.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have Confluence in the new look and navigation
# Create a space
# Go to this space and select the "_Calendars_" menu on the left bar
# Add a calendar
# Then add an event to this calendar (you can add more than one event from a different event type to make is more visible)
# Hover the mouse over the events on the right

h3. Expected Results
The event type's names are aligned with the event's colors and you're able to select them.
h3. Actual Results
The event type's names are one line below the event type's colors and when you hover the mouse over them there's a grey bar. See screenshot below:
 !Screen Shot 2017-07-13 at 11.45.28.png|thumbnail! 

Checking the browser's console we see this:
{code:java}calendar-on-space.js: Team Calendars is using some global variable that threw an error TypeError: Cannot read property 'setDirectCallback' of undefined
    at b (batch.js?build-number=6452&externals=__local-default__&locale=en-GB:1048)
    at HTMLDocument.<anonymous> (batch.js?build-number=6452&externals=__local-default__&locale=en-GB:1048)
    at d (d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/modules/jquery/1.7.2.1-confluence-custom-m04/jquery-min.js:1)
    at Object.add (d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/modules/jquery/1.7.2.1-confluence-custom-m04/jquery-min.js:1)
    at init.ready (d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/modules/jquery/1.7.2.1-confluence-custom-m04/jquery-min.js:1)
    at init (d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/modules/jquery/1.7.2.1-confluence-custom-m04/jquery-min.js:1)
    at s (d2uowa935fr33t.cloudfront.net/download/modules/jquery/1.7.2.1-confluence-custom-m04/jquery-min.js:1)
    at batch.js?build-number=6452&externals=__local-default__&locale=en-GB:1048
    at batch.js?build-number=6452&externals=__local-default__&locale=en-GB:1048
b @ batch.js?build-number=6452&externals=__local-default__&locale=en-GB:1048
{code}
 
h3. Notes
Confluence must be in the new look and navigation.

h3.Workaround
You can still opt out the new look and navigation (for now) and it should work in the old look.
fields.summary: Grey bar on top of the event's names in the space's calendar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51648].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

When using the Panel macro, you can specify the panel width but not  its height. Panel macro size is responsive to its content which can cause two panels set side by side to be unaligned.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow users to set the Panel macro height just like is possible to set the panel width. 
h3. Why this is important

This is important to maintaining the content o a page aligned.
h3.
fields.summary: Ability to set the panel macro height

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a Confluence User shares a page with an individual page with a colleague, the notification the colleague receives indicates that the page was shared with a Group despite only being shared with one person

This can cause confusion as a user may think they have inadvertently shared a page with more than they intended

h3. Suggested Solution
The subject of the message already says "Shared with You"; rather than showing "User shared a page with Group Name" in the body of the message, update the line to "User shared a page with you"

 !SharedWithUser.png|thumbnail! 

If the page is shared with others, they're listed under the "Also shared with"
 
h3. Workaround 
none
fields.summary: Confusing Confluence Shared With Notification

fields.description:
h3. Summary
{quote}I am a space admin for the "Addepar" space, yet I cannot view certain pages. When I go to Space Tools > Permissions > Restricted Pages, clicking "Remove restrictions" I get the padlock screen shown in the screenshot I've attached.{quote}
h3. Environment
*Confluence Unicorn Vertigo

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Restricted Pages created by Space Admins who have left the company leave pages that cannot be administered by anyone, unless you reactivate that user or impersonate that user and remove the restrictions

h3. Expected Results
New Confluence Admin with Space Admin rights, roles, should be to supersede content created/restricted by former employees/users
h3. Actual Results
Receive "You dont' have permission to view this page" This is because it's inheriting restrictions from a parent page. A space admin or the person who shared this page may be able to give you access
h3. Notes
This is entirely restrictive for Confluence Admins tasked with managing spaces and having to resort to impersonating the admin in question to remove the restrictions. Also it's a ticket generator because it should be a lot simpler by providing whoever is now in charge of the site to administer it without having to jump through tedious hoops.
h3.Workaround
* impersonate the user who no longer works or administers Confluence spaces to remove restrictions.
fields.summary: Create Logical process for inheriting/removing page restrictions for new Confluence Administrators

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence Cloud Customers who have the [New Look and Feel|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/new-navigation-and-a-new-look-for-confluence-881536766.html] enabled are not able to edit existing Task Report Macros within their instance

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create and Publish a page with a Task Report Macro
# Edit the page and try to modify the "Space(s) and Page(s)" field


# Edit a page which has an existing Task Report Macro and add a new Task Report Macro
# Try to set the "Space(s) and Page(s)" field

h3. Expected Results
Space/Page is shown in the dropdown autocomplete and the Macro is filtered accordingly

h3. Actual Results
The Space(s) and Page(s) field acts as if it is a plain-text field and does not filter the macro
This results in the macro showing all Tasks within the instance

No errors in Confluence Logs or Browser Developer Console
 
h3. Notes
Labels, Assignee, Creator fields appears to work

h3.Workaround
Temporarily Opt-out of the New Confluence Look and Feel by clicking on the "Opt out for now" link in the Confluence Sidebar

If you cannot opt-out, create a new (temporary) page with a new Task Report macro
Configure the macro as needed and copy it from the editor of the temp page and paste into the page which needs to be updated
fields.summary: Unable to Edit Task Report Macro with New Confluence Look

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After editing a calendar, the action will be displayed in the *All updates* page to anonymous users if anonymous access is enabled in Confluence even though the calendar itself is not publicly available.
The entry will show up even after unsubscribing from the *Team Calendars* add-on.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable Anonymous user access in *Global permissions*
# Edit or create a calendar in a space that is not publicly available.

h3. Expected Results
The edit action does not show up in the *All updates* page for anonymous users as they do not have permissions to view the calendar.

h3. Actual Results
The edit action is displayed in the *All updates* page for anonymous users.
 
h3. Notes
The calendar itself is not accessible to anonymous users.

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Team calendars edits are publicly visible in the All updates page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA Issues macros don't load.
Links to JIRA issues show "Data cannot be retrieved due to an unexpected error."

Environment
 * Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

On affected instance
 # Search for pages containing JIRA macros using: *macroName: jira**
 # Navigate to the page.

Error message
{quote}com.atlassian.applinks.internal.common.auth.oauth.OAuthMessageProblemException: OAuth authentication failed: consumer_key_unknown at com.atlassian.applinks.oauth.auth.OAuthApplinksResponseHandler$1.authenticationFailed(OAuthApplinksResponseHandler.java:96) at com.atlassian.applinks.oauth.auth.OAuthApplinksResponseHandler.handle(OAuthApplinksResponseHandler.java:67) at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.jersey.JerseyRequest$2.handle(JerseyRequest.java:134) at com.atlassian.sal.core.net.HttpClientRequest.executeAndReturn(HttpClientRequest.java:96) at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.jersey.JerseyRequest.executeAndReturn(JerseyRequest.java:131)
{quote}


h3. Workaround
The issue is usually due to a broken Application Link. Please contact Atlassian Support (by logging a support request in [support.atlassian.com|https://support.atlassian.com]) to have the application links reset.
fields.summary: JIRA Issues macros don't load "Data cannot be retrieved due to an unexpected error." OAuth authentication failed: consumer_key_unknown

h3. Summary
When you try to use new search field, some characters are erased while typing 

h3. Environment
Confluence 1000.1668.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click search button at sidebar
# Try to search, please see attached video as an example

h3. Expected Results

fields.description:
h3. Formatting a list item into a Heading (h1,h2..) will cause the entire list to be formatted when a page layout is used

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with a layout
 # create a list with some text items / or a table with some text in each cell
 # Select some Text inside the list / table
 # Apply a different Heading style to it.

h3. Expected Behavior
Only the selected text will be changed into the selected Heading style

h3. Actual Behavior
All text inside the section / layout gets the style applied to it.

h3. Notes
* This behaviour also happens in tinymce 4 core, and is a result of having a page layout which is set to contenteditable=true, this exposes bugs related to the editor root.
* only affects content that are in a Page Layout
* affects tables as well
* Does not happen in non Foxy editor (tinymce 3)
fields.summary: Formatting a list item into a Heading (h1,h2..) will cause the entire list to be formatted when a page layout is used

{panel:title=Atlassian update on August 21, 2018}
If you're impacted by this bug, you may want to work around this issue for your users by setting the default home page as described here: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/set-your-site-homepage-873871363.html]

h3. Summary

User who are given access to Confluence only (while there are JIRA in the instance), will be redirected to JIRA Dashboard/Customer Portal (if the instance has JIRA Service Desk) when they try to access the instance's URL
h3. Environment

JIRA v1000.1010.1
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user and give Confluence access only (in default environment, include the user in "confluence-users" group only)
 # login as the user
 # Try to access the instance's URL (<instance-name>.atlassian.net)

h3. Expected Results

User redirected to Confluence (<instance-name>.atlassian.net/wiki/discover/all-updates)
h3. Actual Results

User redirected to JIRA (<instance-name>.atlassian.net/secure/Dashboard.jspa) as a logged out user (can see log in button on top right) OR to JIRA Service Desk customer's portal
h3. Notes

This happened simultaneously with the appearance of this bug:
 - Unable to choose default homepage anymore in Atlassian Cloud

h3. Workaround
 * Click on the "Application Navigator" and select Confluence. User will be redirected to Confluence as a logged in user immediately. (If redirected to JIRA Dashboard)
 * Navigate to <instance-name>.atlassian.net/wiki (If redirected to Customer Portal)
fields.summary: Users with only Confluence Access got Redirected to JIRA Dashboard

fields.description:
h2. Problem Description

If customer processed migration from Confluence Server to Cloud using site import, which contains a lot of Users and Memberships, it will take a very long hour to complete.

h2. Steps to Replicate

For this, it was tested against a site backup from server that is 13MB zipped. However having approximately 3k users, 1.6k groups and 30k membership association. 

h2. Expected Result

It completes in less than an hour similar to site import in Confluence Server

h2. Actual Result

It took approximately 13 hours to complete import the instance

h2. Observation

From the progress, it seems to be stopping at a certain percentage for a long while. Without access to the log, customer unable to tell what is happening. From the supporter's perspective, the import is firing rest events to create users and adding them to memberships. Which take a great amount of time if the data come from a big instance.
fields.summary: Very Slow Import Process for Site Import that Contains a lot of Users and Memberships

When trying to [move a page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/move-and-reorder-pages-724764858.html], the user is unable to use the "tab" key in order to go to directly to the "Move" button. Instead, it will unselect the button.

* Double hit the *tab* key so it will redirect to the *Cancel* button, then, *Shift+tab* to go to the *Move* button
* Use the mouse instead.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Confluence tracks changes via page history [Page History and Page Comparison views|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/page-history-and-page-comparison-views-724765079.html]

It would be helpful that rather than seeing the changes made in the history, that they can be actively tracked in Collaborative Editing, for example, by enabling a "Track Changes" functionality

h3. Suggested Solution
Rather than having the modifications happening in real-time, showing the changes made (e.g. deleted lines showing as strikethrough rather than being deleted, green for when a line is added, blue when formatting is changed). In addition, the page administrator would have to approve these changes before they go live. Include as well the ability to switch between proposed changes and approve them individually.

h3. Why this is important
Allows users to have active involvement in updating of a document and understanding the changes, more control over how the end result of a page looks.
fields.summary: Track changes functionality

fields.description:
The new share dialog in production, a few feedback items:

* Every time I press share, I see a loading throbber - why? We don't typically have a click and change the menu item to a loading throbber. What's taking so long to load? Why? It never used to be there.
* The loading throbber loads on the wrong icon - on the pencil icon, not the share icon... 
!https://d1ax1i5f2y3x71.cloudfront.net/items/3V1p3g281N452T310925/Screen%20Recording%202017-07-05%20at%2008.57%20AM.gif?X-CloudApp-Visitor-Id=94ec2bb392da5ece5e1e2de5f8d32a5c&v=698ad504!

* The share text area, which, arguably, is where the user spends most of their time writing the actual reason they want to share something doesn't grow as you type. So if I write more than two lines... which I typically do, the text area doesn't grow as I type.. and it used to.. seems a regression on the user experience?
